clinical_study.brief_title: Natural History and Outcome Measures in Alexander Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Natural History and Outcome Measures in Alexander Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to define the natural history of Alexander Disease, a leukodystrophy that causes neurological dysfunction. Investigators will obtain clinical outcome assessments to measure how the disease affects a patient's gross motor, fine motor, speech and language function, swallowing, and quality of life. The data obtained from this study will be used for the design of future treatment trials.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants will be asked to complete physical examinations including physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech and language therapy, and swallowing assessments. Patients (or caretakers) may be asked to complete questionnaires as well. The study asks for participants to return at least once yearly to repeat assessments.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Gross Motor Function Over Time
primary_outcome.description: Total score and dimensional scores (rolling/supine, crawling/traveling, sitting, standing, and walking/running) will be calculated at each visit. Change in total and dimensional scores over time will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Bruininks-Oseretsky Test of Motor Proficiency Over Time
secondary_outcome.description: Composite score and scores for the 4 sub-scales will be calculated at each visit. Change in composite and subscale scores over time will be assessed.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Peabody Developmental Motor Scales Over Time
other_outcome.description: Composite score and 4 sub-scales (reflexes, stationary, locomotion, object manipulation) will be calculated at each visit. Change in composite and subscale scores over time will be assessed.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Rosetti Infant-Toddler Language Scale Over Time
other_outcome.description: Change in six sub-scales (Interaction-Attachment, Pragmatics, Gesture, Play, Language Comprehension, and Language Expression) will be assessed at each visit for age applicable patients.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Swallowing Performance Over Time
other_outcome.description: A clinical swallow evaluation will be performed and assessed for change annually using an ordinal classification scale based on performance.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Clinical Evaluation of Language Fundamentals Over Time
other_outcome.description: Changes in the comprehensive scores will be assessed at baseline and then annually at each visit which will be scheduled within ± 2 months around the specified time point, for up to 10 years

other_outcome.measure: Change in Peabody Picture Vocabulary Test Over Time
other_outcome.description: Changes in comprehensive scores will be assessed at baseline and then annually at each visit which will be scheduled within ± 2 months around the specified time point, for up to 10 years

other_outcome.measure: Change in Goldman-Fristoe Test of Articulation Over Time
other_outcome.description: Changes in standardized scores will be assessed at baseline and then annually at each visit which will be scheduled within ± 2 months around the specified time point, for up to 10 years

study_pop.textblock: Patients who have been diagnosed with Alexander Disease.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with Alexander Disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other Leukodystrophies will not be enrolled
